item.title: Build Your Own Private Cloud Storage
item.description: Lots of small and midsize businesses are using cloud storage, particularly for disaster recovery. However, local storage is still necessary. While Storage Attached Networks (SANs) are a common solution, they’re expensive and complex. A simpler option exists. Introducing Drobo, an advanced hard disk storage solution that’s surprisingly easy to use. It works with standard 3.5" SATA drives of any capacity, resembling a straightforward multi-bay drive enclosure. Adding or removing drives, even swapping a 1 TB for a 2 TB, is always possible.

item.title: Drobo Mr. Storage Roboto
item.description: Hard drive space disappears faster than you can imagine, especially with large digital media files like photos and videos. Even large hard drives fill up quickly. While upgrading or adding hard drives seems like a solution, it creates new problems like managing backups and worrying about data loss from hard drive failures. These tasks can be time-consuming, especially for professionals working with large files. It’s almost like you need a personal assistant to manage it all.

item.title: Counterfeit software discovered in Singapore sold as authentic in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: This image depicts a counterfeit Certificate of Authenticity (COA). It only displays the product name and lacks any anti-counterfeiting measures. Microsoft recently uncovered a case of software piracy originating from a supplier in Singapore. The case involved an Australian reseller found to be in possession of fake COAs and other counterfeit software and hardware. COAs are labels or stickers affixed to the packaging of products like Windows, Office, and Windows Server.

item.title: Local computer vendor in Singapore raided by police, counterfeit Microsoft software discovered
item.description: Microsoft is urging consumers and small businesses to be cautious when buying software, warning them about the risks of accidentally purchasing and using counterfeit products. This advisory comes after a recent raid on a computer vendor in Kembangan Plaza by the Intellectual Property Rights Branch (IPRB) of the Singapore Police Force. The shop in question had been advertising unauthorized “Microsoft license keys” as genuine and offering computers bundled with counterfeit software at heavily discounted prices through their online store.

item.title: How Does Cloud Computing Work In Business?
item.description: The term “cloud” is frequently used today. But what exactly is it, and how can it benefit your business by improving efficiency, speed, and affordability? Let’s delve into it. In business, the term “cloudy” often carries a negative connotation, implying uncertainty and unpredictability. Naturally, clarity and predictability are preferred, especially from a financial standpoint. Therefore, it’s understandable why people might be skeptical when advised to transition their business to the cloud.
